p: Anti-Dengue virus IgM antibodies accounted for 15% (39/260) of the total patient’s samples tested. Of these, 8 were positive for only Dengue-specific IgM and 31 for both IgM and IgG. A larger proportion of positives, 25% (8/31) for both IgG and IgM were within the age group of 21–40 years compared with the least in the age groups of the ≤ 5 and ≥ 51 years. Males as against females recorded the highest occurrence of Dengue IgM antibodies of 15.48% (13/84) and 14.77% (26/176) respectively, though no significant association was observed for IgM antibodies and gender.
